title: Systems Engineer-Scandinavia
description:
**Join Extreme Networks, a leading provider of cloud-managed networking solutions.**

We're seeking a talented Systems Engineer to join our dynamic team to work in Scandinavia and to contribute our mission of simplifying and securing the access network.

There has never been a better time to join Extreme Networks, with several acquisitions extending our portfolio and go to market strategy, we have seen enormous opportunity and growth within the region.

Aside from being a Technology Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, we also adamantly promote an internal culture that truly embraces diversity, inclusion and equality in the workplace.

Extreme Systems Engineer provides technology and product consulting, technical sales support for various account opportunities, performs high-level and in-depth technical presentations for customers, prospects, and Extreme channel partners in the territory of responsibility.

Extreme Systems Engineer also provides support for RFI/RFP responses, organizes and leads Proof of Concept activities, designs solutions meeting customer requirements.

Systems Engineer is also required to participate with assigned virtual teams and contribute to other team activities.

Domestic/International travel will be required.
### **Candidate Requirements:**

* Excellent presentation skills (fluent in Swedish and English)
* Strong, successful pre-sales engineering track record in the industry and territory in a similar position is necessary
* A sound knowledge of fundamental networking technologies:
* Layer 2/3 switching
* IPv4/v6 routing concepts
* Overlay networking, VPNs
* Wi-Fi operation and design
* Network security principles
* Knowledge and practical experience in these areas are an advantage:
* Cloud technologies and Cloud-based network management platforms
* Compute and network virtualization principles
* Network management and orchestration software
* SD-WAN
* Automation scripting and APIs
* Ability to work as a part of customer project teams on design and PoC labs, setting criteria for successful PoCs, and overall solution designs
* Tenacity and perseverance (customer advocate facing internally to Extreme)
* Ability to build, develop, and maintain a network of people at the customer/partner side independent of sales being accepted as the trusted advisor
* When growing the business the willingness to assume a team-lead role for the account team when/if business requires additional resources.
* Experience working with partners is a plus for technical training on products.
* Major account experience and experience in closing deals is necessary.
* Extreme Networks certifications are desirable, but not mandatory
* Recognized industry certifications is a plus
* Ability to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of future trends and market directions
* Ability to support customer evaluations, demonstrations and detailed design requirements
* Good general hands-on lab experience is required

**About Extreme Networks**
Extreme Networks is a global leader in cloud-managed networking solutions. We're committed to simplifying and securing the access network for organizations of all sizes. Our innovative technology and customer-centric approach have made us a trusted partner for 30,000+ customers worldwide.

By harnessing the power of cloud computing, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, Extreme offers unparalleled simplicity and security for access networks. Our Cloud-Managed Wireless, Switching, Routing, and Security technologies provide unrivalled flexibility in deployment, management, and licensing. Working with pioneering Controller-less Wi-Fi and Cloud Management, Extreme delivers continuous innovation at Cloud-speed that constantly challenges the industry norm, allowing customers to rethink what’s possible.
company_description: For nearly 25 years, Extreme Networks has been helping customers to advance their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before.

title: Cloud Network Tech Lead
description:
* *Urval sker löpande*
* *Stockholm*
* *Hybrid*
***Arbetsuppgifter***
---------------------

*Vi söker nu en Cloud Network Tech Lead till Handelsbanken. Rollen erbjuder utvecklande ledarskap och du ges möjligheten att påverka bankens nätverkslösningar.*

***Ditt team***  

*Som Cloud Network Tech Lead kommer du vara del av bankens Cloud Center of Excellence (CCoE).* *Där kommer du att samarbeta med områdets molnarkitekter, utvecklare och supportpersonal som tillsammans designar, implementerar och vidareutvecklar bankens molnlösningar. Du kommer även arbeta nära bankens säkerhetsfunktion.*

*Du kommer att tillhöra nätverksteamet som består av dig som Tech Lead och 2 tekniker. Vi arbetar enligt agil metodik.*

***Din roll***  

*Som Network Tech Lead kommer du främst leda det tekniska arbetet och ge vägledning för Azurearbetet i nätverksteamet. Du kommer designa och implementera nätverkslösningar i Azure med hög tillgänglighet, samt ansvara för att vidareutveckla befintliga lösningar i nätverksmiljön. Du ansvarar även för low level design. Stor del av rollen innebär att utveckla och leda andra där du möjliggör andras tillväxt genom kompetensdelning.*  



***Vi har riktigt bra förmåner***
---------------------------------

* *Tjänstepension*
* *Vinstdelningssystem*
* *Gruppförsäkring*
* *Friskvårdsbidrag*
* *Bidrag vid föräldraledighet*
* *Banktjänster*
* *Banking services*
* *Benefit in connection with parental leave*
* *Health promotion subsidy*
* *Group insurance*
* *Occupational pension*
* *Profit-sharing scheme*
***Kvalifikationer***
---------------------

***Din profil***  

*För denna roll behöver du omfattande erfarenhet inom Azure, nätverks design samt “OnPrem” nätverk. Därigenom har du skaffat dig goda kunskaper i hur olika nätverksfunktioner som DNS, Routing, Proxy och brandväggar fungerar. Du är väl införstådd i säkerhetsaspekter kopplat till nätverk samt har ett allmänt högt säkerhetstänk. Du har erfarenhet från en ledarroll där du ansvarat för tekniska team. Då vi samarbetar med hela organisationen behöver du behärska god svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.*

*Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av IaC (ARM, Bicep), har Microsoft certifieringar inom Azure, samt scriptkunskaper i Powershell eller Python.*

*Du skaffar dig god förståelse för ditt uppdrag och kan kommunicera det anpassat utifrån mottagaren. Ditt pedagogiska förhållningssätt underlättar när du vägleder och stöttar kollegor. Du är inlyssnande, tillgänglig och bidrar med din erfarenhet. Därtill skapar du långsiktiga relationer och inkluderar olika perspektiv för att möjliggöra områdets målsättningar. Ditt arbetssätt är strukturerat och du följer processer men skapar även nya vid behov.*  



***Vi erbjuder***

* *en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare*
* *dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete*
* *work-life balance*
* *kompetens- och karriärutveckling*
* *inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö*
* *konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket*

**Om företaget**
----------------

Hos oss får du ett stort eget ansvar och möjlighet att påverka din egen och bankens framtida utveckling. Våra olika perspektiv, insikter och innovativa idéer utgör en grund för hur vi tillsammans bygger vidare banken för framtiden. För oss är utveckling allt och när du utvecklas, utvecklas banken.

title: SAP Team Manager - Göteborg
description:
***Join our expanding*** ***NORDIC PBS*** ***Team and help leading organizations unlock the value of technology. We specialize in delivering comprehensive SAP solutions that help our clients stay ahead in a rapidly evolving business landscape. Our team is composed of innovative and forward-thinking professionals who are dedicated to achieving excellence.***

**Capgemini are seeking a dynamic and experienced Team Manager to lead the SAP team in Göteborg. The ideal candidate will have extensive consultant experience in SAP S/4HANA and a proven track record in team leadership, motivation, and strategic execution, and now want to take the next step into people management. This could be the chance for you!**  

  

**YOUR ROLE:**  

  

**You will have 15-20 direct reporting consultants. This role will be a combined role as 50% manager and 50% consultant being out in project delivery or working with presales. Strong footprint and good knowledge in the business in Göteborg’s region.**  



**In your role, you will:**  



* **Lead, mentor, and motivate a team of senior and junior SAP consultants to achieve project objectives and deliver exceptional results**
* **Drive team performance through effective utilization management, performance evaluations, and competence development initiatives**
* **Foster a collaborative and inclusive team environment, promoting open communication and knowledge sharing**
* **Manage team budget, ensuring optimal resource allocation and adherence to financial targets**
* **Salary settings and yearly salary discussion with consultant**
* **Recruit and attract top talents and support team growth objectives with support from the Talent Acquisition team**
* **Collaborate with sales and presales teams to develop winning strategies and deliver compelling proposals to clients**
* **Execute on company strategy to drive business growth and expansion**

  

**YOUR PROFILE:**  



* **Minimum of 7 years of experience in SAP consulting, with a focus on SAP S/4HANA implementations**
* **Proven experience managing project teams and delivering SAP implementation projects on time and within budget**
* **Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate both senior and junior team members**
* **Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients and internal stakeholders**
* **In-depth knowledge of SAP S/4HANA modules and functionality**
* **Fluency in English and Swedish language**
* **Live in Sweden and have eligible work permit to work in Sweden**

  

  

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI:****Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries.**  

  

**With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2022 global revenues of €22 billion. Get the Future You Want |** **www.capgemini.com**

title: Strategic Partner Account Manager, Northern Europe
description:
Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection—providing natively integrated, all-in-one solutions that monitor, control, and protect the data that businesses and lives depend on. We are looking for a Strategic Partner Account Manager to join our mission to create a #CyberFit future and protect all data, applications, and systems across any environment.



The Strategic Partner Account Manager will drive the establishment, management, and growth of Acronis' presence within existing and new service provider partners. This role will work in close collaboration with the sales managers and leaders at each of our service providers to increase Acronis' revenue, customer base, and market share within their business. The Strategic Partner Account Manager role is ideal for a top seller with strong strategic and tactical sales management skills. The sales professional will balance short-term sales activities with long-term strategic initiatives. The impact of decisions and actions taken locally may be felt globally due to the scale of Acronis' largest service provider partners.

  


**WHAT YOU'LL DO**


* Establish, manage, and grow Acronis' presence within existing and new service provider partners
* Grow incremental Annual Recurring Revenue/sales through the management of sales initiatives
* Responsible for training, onboarding, and enablement of new/prospective service providers
* Expected to deliver monthly, quarterly and annual partner forecast/pipeline and business activity to the Acronis sales management team
* Recruit, onboard, and train new MSP partners
* Conduct Quarterly Business Reviews and Quarterly Business Planning Sessions with assigned SP partners
* Enable cross-functional cooperation between Sales, Marketing, Professional Services, Acronis Academy, and other teams including Acronis executives as necessary
* Work with Service Providers to sell to their existing base of customers to increase adoption of Acronis Cyber Protection services
* Collaborate across multiple departments, including sales, marketing, finance, business development, engineering, and operations, to ensure seamless account management and communication


**WHAT YOU BRING**


* 5+ years of total sales/account management experience, specifically with strategic large accounts experience is required
* 3+ years of experience and demonstrated sales success in recruiting and managing service provider partners, with a focus on backup, disaster recovery, security, or related cloud technologies
* Solid strategic business development, planning, and acumen, along with strong tactical implementation sales skills
* Technical aptitude to deliver sales and product training, with a strong understanding of product positioning and client technical needs
* Outstanding organizational, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills
* Working knowledge of MS Office and Management of daily activities through CRM applications including Sales Force
* Regional travel is required in the role. Must be willing to travel on a frequent basis, up to 50% of the time
* Strong written and verbal English communication and interpersonal skills

  


**WHO WE ARE**



Acronis is a global cyber protection company that provides natively integrated cybersecurity, data protection, and endpoint management for managed service providers (MSPs), small and medium businesses (SMBs), enterprise IT departments and home users. Our all-in-one solutions are highly efficient and designed to identify, prevent, detect, respond, remediate, and recover from modern cyberthreats with minimal downtime, ensuring data integrity and business continuity. We offer the most comprehensive security solution on the market for MSPs with our unique ability to meet the needs of diverse and distributed IT environments.



A Swiss company founded in Singapore in 2003, Acronis offers over twenty years of innovation with 15 offices worldwide and more than 1800 employees in 50+ countries. Acronis Cyber Protect is available in 26 languages in 150 countries and is used by over 20,000 service providers to protect over 750,000 businesses.



Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities we serve. Mutual trust, respect and belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of our team. Each member of our "A-Team" plays an instrumental role in driving the success of our innovative and expanding business. We seek individuals who excel in dynamic, global environments and have a never give up attitude, contributing to our collective growth and impact.


*Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.*

title: Teknisk koordinator till Saab Aeronautics
description:
Tog du nyligen examen inom teknik och vill arbeta verksamhets- och projektnära inom tekniska områden? Saab Aeronauticssöker nu en nyexaminerad [tjänst] med intresse för produktion, kvalité och design.Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv
  
  

Att jobba som teknisk koordinator på Saab Aeronautics
  
Som teknisk koordinator kommer du att tillhöra FAI (First Article Inspection), en av sektionerna inom produktionsteknik sammanbyggnad inom Saab Aeronautics. FAI är en viktig del av att kvalitetssäkra industrialiseringsarbetet och säkra en effektiv serieproduktion inom området Sammanbyggnad.I rollen som teknisk koordinator kommer du styra och koordinera arbetet med FAI-dokumentation, fördela anmärkningar till berörda discipliner och säkerställa att de tas om hand om på rätt sätt. Du kommer ha ett nära samarbete med produktionsteknik, produktion, kvalitet och design.För att lyckas som FAI-koordinator behöver du ha ett teknikintresse samt en vilja att arbeta med förbättringar. Du behöver också kunna arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och inte heller vara rädd för att ställa krav på dina kollegor. Slutligen så behöver du vara noggrann, kvalitetsmedveten och förstå vikten av att följa uppsatta processer och regelverk.
  
Rollen är placerad i Linköping.
  
  

Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab i Linköpingmed start omgående.Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet,men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.
  
Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saabsamt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är i början av din karriär och har en universitetsexamen inom teknik
  
Har ett intresse för projekt, produktion, förbättring och administration.
  
Som person är intresserad av helheten, tycker om att driva arbetet framåt och vågar ställa krav.
  
Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
  
Har goda kunskaper i affärssystem. Det är meriterande att ha kunskap om kvalitetssystem eller erfarenhet frånproduktionstekniskt- eller kvalitetsarbete.
  
  

Ansökan
  
Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.
  
Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
  
  

Om Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent här.

title: Global Account Manager, Automotive, Automotive Global Accounts
description:
* The ideal candidate would have experience working with large Automotive OEM organizations or Industrial Manufacturers or Global suppliers as an Account and Relationship Manager.
* Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication, analytical and presentation skills are required.
* Decision making, problem solving, and negotiating skills are also important for this role.


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking talented sales individuals for the Automotive Global Accounts team focused on growing business and defining the cloud computing industry in the world’s largest, most strategic, multinational Fortune 100 companies.
  
  

AWS, the world’s leading cloud provider, offers cutting-edge cloud solutions that benefit companies of all sizes. We are growing our new Global Accounts Sales team which focuses on helping the world's largest multinational businesses in the Automotive industry adopt the AWS cloud platform. If you are passionate about the cloud and have the skills, the Global Account Manager role will provide you with the unique opportunity, landing business-transforming solutions to the world’s biggest and most impactful companies, and shape the future of cloud computing and the Automotive industry.
  
  

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future. As part of your work you will also recruit and develop others by mentoring in your organization and/or at your location. You will provide constructive peer feedback and promotion assessments for these earlier in their sales career.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
Every global customer is unique, hence the respective sales team’s set up could vary per account, ranging from one to several Global Account Managers around the world, carrying shared goals to ensure customer success, and therefore you could be working as part of the team owning a territory/part of a global account. As part of your role, you will be responsible for relationships with key influencers and decision-makers, specifically CXOs, and you will own respective initiatives for which you will define the priorities for your territory/part of a global account. You will work backwords from customers, helping them solve complex business problems via technology. You will create and execute sales strategies, account plans to accelerate customer adoption and meet customer acquisition, revenue attainment, and/or growth goals. You will define new opportunities, and own the full-cycle sales engagements. You will build and lead diverse virtual teams, and enlist senior leaders and executives across AWS and broader Amazon to support velocity of your engagements. You will solve ambiguous problems and proactively identify and mitigate risks.
  
  

You will also impact mechanisms beyond your assigned accounts (e.g., influencing playbooks, identifying gaps between teams, processes, and plans) and contribute to the standards for account management best practices. You will provide input into the creation of team goals, and influence multiple partner team goals and priorities.
  
  

About the team
  
About AWS
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS?
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
  

Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship & Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
  

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

* MBA preferred or equivalent experience.
* Extensive enterprise selling experience in large global accounts.
* Experience in large complex deal negotiations with a successful track record
* The ability to navigate across AWS and the customer in a trusted advisor/consultative approach, establishing credibility quickly with senior level executives across the organizations.
* A strong understanding of AWS and/or technology as a service (Iaas, SaaS, PaaS) would be preferred but not required.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Data Analyst
description:
**Data Analyst**  

**Freelance / Contractor**  

**Stockholm onsite**  

**7 month contract**

  

Our client is looking for a data analyst to proactively identify strategic challenges where decision support anchored in data is needed.


You must have the right to work in Sweden without restrictions and ideally be based in Stockholm.

**Responsibilities**


* Be the driver for data driven decisions making in your initiative/product team by taking data into insights and provide the team with clear, data driven recommendations.
* Build and maintain analytics products supporting business decision making.
* Be responsible for the full analysis process from problem and scope definition to data extraction, cleaning, analysis, visualization, creating recommendations, and presenting results in collaboration with the Data & Analytics Team.
* Turn business challenges into structured data analyse. Define and setup measurable KPIs and OKRs, own and maintain their visualization for value reporting.
* Be the data analytics expert in cross-functional teams and collaborate with business stakeholders to solve business challenges using data analytics.
* Work on a broad variety of business challenges with a wide range of business stakeholders (customer, sales, marketing, merchandizing, finance etc.).
* Participate in wider analytics community.


**Key experience and qualifications required**

  

You must have all of the following experience and competencies, which must be evidenced in your CV:


* Good understanding of marketing channels attribution models, including last non direct click, Multi-Touch Attribution (MTA) and Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing channels and campaigns.
* Proven experience in data analysis on platforms such as Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads, and other major digital advertising platforms.
* Experience with data integration and ETL platforms like Adverity, Dataddo, or similar tools to collect, clean, and aggregate data from multiple digital marketing platforms.
* Familiarity with Digital Advertising Strategies, campaign optimization/SEO techniques, and performance measurement across various paid media channels.
* Have an academic degree in a quantitative field (economics, business, engineering, statistics, finance, computer science etc.)
* Have strong business sense and business interest with the ability of making sound interpretations of data and other information.
* Have excellent communication skills and are skilled in translating and explaining complex data analysis to non-technical and/or senior stakeholders.
* Have hands-on working experience writing advanced SQL queries to extract, prep, validate, and analyze large data sets.
* Have hands on experience creating Analytical tool suites with PowerBI or Looker studio etc.
* Have hands on experience building data analytics solutions using programming languages such Python, or R
* Have previous working experience or comfortable working with one of cloud platform data analytics stack i.e. Azure (Azure - SQL Server) or GCP – big query
* Have skills in Microsoft excel functions such as: power pivot, power query. Tabular Editor, DAX etc.
* Are prestige less and enjoy collaborating with others to solve problems.
* Are fluent in English

title: Provningsingenjör till företag inom trafiksäkerhetstestning
description:
**Tog du nyligen examen inom elektroteknik, mekanik eller motsvarande** **och vill arbeta med test** **av fordon? Vi söker nu en nyexaminerad provningsingenjör med intresse för fordon.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.**

**Att jobba som provningsingenjör**

  

Som provningsingenjör blir du en nyckelfigur i verksamheten, där du ansvarar för noggrant genomförda tester som stöd för både kunder och forskningsprojekt. Uppdragen varierar från att arbeta med aktiva säkerhetssystem till förarlösa autonoma fordon och simulerade gränskorsningar för självkörande fordon. Dina dagliga arbetsuppgifter består av att sätta upp testmiljöer, genomföra tester samt att samla in data. För att trivas i rollen ska du ha en god förståelse för reglertekniska system, vara service minded och tycka om att jobba hands-on.


Rollen är placerad i Hällered.

**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**


Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos kund med start i februari. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos kund.


**Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en högskoleingenjörsexamen inom elektoteknik, mekanik, maskinteknik eller motsvarande
* Har ett genuint intresse för fordon och tycker om att köra bil
* Som person är service minded och tycker om att jobba praktiskt
* Har grundläggande kunskaper i MatLab och/eller Python
* Innehar svenskt B-körkort

Behärskar svenska i tal och skrift  
* 

  

**Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Yttermo på olivia.yttermo@nexergroup.com


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 **Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är specialiserade på att ge nyutexaminerade techtalanger en ultimat start på karriären genom våra ettåriga talangprogram. Vi matchar talangers unika kompetens, personlighet och potential med ett uppdrag hos ett av Sveriges främsta bolag. Uppdraget varvas med en gedigen utbildning, mentorskap och sociala aktiviteter. Nexer Tech Talent ger techtalanger en ultimat övergång mellan studier och arbetsliv och en brant utvecklingskurva mot en lovande framtid. Vi är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 4500 medarbetare i 14 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt.*

title: Liquidity & Funding Analyst
description:
Northmill Bank is a pioneering financial institution at the intersection of technology and finance, committed to revolutionizing the way people manage and protect their financial well-being. We are creating a different kind of banking experience, **digital yet personal**.


Northmill Bank was founded in 2006 and have grown to over 180 employees in 4 countries, 2.500 merchants and 600.000 end users. We use the latest technology to develop safe, smart, and user-friendly products for our customers. They are the sole reason why we do what we do. We are a 100% cloud-based product company where technology is the driver to create smarter banking products.

  

Grab this opportunity to be a part of us and our journey!

**About the role**


Northmill is seeking an experienced Liquidity and Funding Analyst to join our Treasury team. The ideal candidate will have a background in banking or other regulated industries and bring hands-on experience in liquidity management and funding strategies. This role will be key in ensuring the company’s financial stability and operational liquidity, while also managing profit and loss (P&L) for funding activities. The role will report directly to the CFO.

**Responsibilities**

* Liquidity strategy and planning.
* Responsible for the P&L of Northmill’s funding, including evaluation of new funding sources.
* Liquidity management, including cash management and liquidity portfolio management.
* Monitoring, analysis and reporting of Northmill’s liquidity risks.
* Build up and manage Northmill’s internal bank.
* ILAAP and liquidity recovery plan.
* Ensure that Northmill meets all requirements from the Central Bank.
* Manage relationships with other cooperating banks.
* Daily liquidity controls.
* Ad-hoc analysis related to liquidity.

**About you**  

  

We are looking for a detail-oriented Liquidity and Funding Analyst with an interest in financial markets and a strong ability to turn data into actionable insights. The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker, capable of analyzing complex financial data and developing solutions to optimize liquidity management and funding strategies.

* A university degree within business/economics, engineering, mathematics or equivalent
* Minimum 3 years’ relevant work experience from within the financial sector or equivalent consulting background
* Experience from working in a regulated company
* Knowledge of relevant regulations

**Fun Facts:**

* Work-life balance - hit the gym two minutes away or go for a jog in the city.
* Event - highly appreciated “Northchill”.
* Health - 5000 kr health care allowance
* Breakfast and fruits every day, as well as "holy fika” each Friday.
* Regular after work and celebrated successes at the office.
* Stockholm's most beautiful office space, right in the city center with incredible views and our very own roof top terrace.

**Apply today and be a part of Northmill!**

title: Cloudutvecklare på TechSeed Hyperautomation
description:
*På TechSeed är vi övertygade om att det är tekniken som kommer göra världen till en bättre plats. Vi ser ett stort behov i vårt samhälle att kombinera affärsförståelse, digitalt ledarskap samt innovativa arbetssätt och lösningar med framtidens tekniker i uppkopplade ekosystem. Vi tror på en hållbar framtid med säkra lösningar genom exempelvis IoT-lösningar, digitala tvillingar, AI och cybersäkerhet. Det här är vårt WHY och det fyller oss med energi varje dag. Det här är vår arena.*


TechSeed är ett medarbetarägt bolag som erbjuder konsulttjänster och har ett kompetensdjup inom flera domäner. Vi är på en kraftig tillväxtresa och söker nu **utvecklare** som även kommer få en stor grad av inflytande och insyn i hur vi växer framåt och tar ett helhetsgrepp om uppkopplade ekosystem och lösningar. Vi söker dig som trivs i konsultrollen och samtidigt vill bidra till att skapa vägen framåt för TechSeed – Tillsammans.


I denna roll kommer du vara del av ett team som fokuserar på Integration och Cloud, där vi är i en spännande uppstartsfas. I rollen som utvecklare kommer du arbeta som konsult i samarbete med våra kunder. Vi kommer samarbeta för att hitta lämpliga uppdrag och anpassa både uppdrag och roll utifrån dina intressen och din bakgrund. Ditt team tillhör enheten **TechSeed Hyperautomation** som specialiserar sig inom arkitektur, integration, automation och projektledning. Enhetens vision och uppdrag är att sammanlänka olika delar av organisationer och tekniker för att minska manuella metoder som kräver mycket tid och resurser. Deras tjänster inkluderar RPA, BPA, traditionella integrationer och APIer, AI, ML, Computer vision och low code-lösningar.


Enheten präglas av en stark förmåga att bygga strukturer och se sammanhang och en stark sammanhållning. Som delägare och anställd kommer du vara med i utvecklingen av våra erbjudanden, få möjlighet att påverka de områden som du drivs av och samtidigt få tryggheten av ett team med gemensamt mål och gemensamma intressen.


Vår grund ligger i att vi delar med oss av vår passion för teknik och värdet vi skapar. Det handlar bland annat om kunskapsutbyte och att dela idéer, bidra med god stämning såväl som att skapa värde genom vårt delägarskap. Vi erbjuder dig:

  

* Inflytande i hur vi bygger TechSeed tillsammans
* En öppen kultur där vi värdesätter olikheter, insikter och innovationer
* Direkt värde från våra finansiella resultat genom bonus och delägarskap
* Möjligheten att växa in i olika tekniska områden / ansvarsområden utifrån dina önskemål
* Flexibelt arbete hemifrån, beroende på uppdragets behov.

**Vem söker vi?**


Vi söker dig vars expertis är utveckling! Vi söker dig som är nyfiken på ny teknik, trivs i roller där du utvecklas och trivs i en kultur där vi hjälps åt och bygger bolaget **tillsammans**. För att trivas behöver du vara bekväm i rollen som utvecklare och ha minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet. Vi söker dig som har:

* God förståelse för cloudtekniker, cloudarkitektur och utveckling av mikrotjänster i antingen AWS eller Azure
* Goda kunskaper inom containers (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Din styrka i Java eller C#
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD pipelines, IaC (Terraform, CloudFormation
* Erfarenhet av API och integration
* Trivs i en miljö som präglas av samarbete och gemensamma mål


Eftersom vi arbetar med flera typer av kunder med olika behov krävs det för rollen att vara obehindrad i både svenska och engelska, tal och skrift. Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom automotive, erfarenhet som konsult eller av ScaleUp-miljöer.

 **Om TechSeed**


Vi är ett medarbetarägt konsultbolag i ScaleUp-fasen med visionen att skapa värde med uppkopplade lösningar. Vi tror på kombinationen av nära samarbeten, framtidens tekniker och att gemensamt arbeta för att skapa ett bolag vi verkligen trivs på. **Genom att erbjuda delägarskap till våra anställda ger vi möjligheten till insyn och påverkan, samtidigt som det gynnar samarbeten och att prioritera vad som är bäst för gruppen**. Detta speglas både i vår kultur och våra erbjudanden, där vi kombinerar vårt stora tekniska intresse med ett kundanpassat förhållningssätt samtidigt som vi har många sociala aktiviteter och en härlig gemenskap på kontoret. Vår arena är uppkopplade ekosystem, där tekniker som IoT och Intelligent Edge används för att skapa uppkopplade tjänster och system inom ekosystem som Smart Cities, Smart Factories, Smart Companies och Smart Buildings.

title: Systemingenjör till Saab Surveillance
description:
**Tog du nyligen examen inom teknik och vill arbeta med en varierad roll inom integration och verifiering? Saab Surveillance söker nu en nyexaminerad systemingenjör med intresse för kommunikatnätverk och dataplattformar. Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv**

 **Att jobba som systemingenjör på Saab Surveillance**

  

Saab söker en person som kommer att vara en del av Giraffe AMB, Arthur Integration- och verifieringsteam.Du kommer tillhöra ett område som arbetar med integration och verifiering av våra projekt, kundleveranser samt demonstrationer för potentiella kunder. Vi stöttar även integrationen av våra produkter i systemlösningar. Arbetet sker både i laboratoriemiljö och i fält med kompletta sensorsystem.  

  

Du kommer att arbeta nära projektledning och systemansvariga för att sätta förväntningar och hålla tidsfrister. Du kommer också samarbeta med ingenjörsteam för att bygga lösningar som möter kundernas behov. Din roll omfattar att analysera krav, utforma verifieringstester och genomföra formella verifierings- och acceptanstester tillsammans med kunden. Dessutom kommer du att assistera vid installation och service hos kund.


Rollen är placerad i Göteborg.

 **Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**

Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab i Göteborg med start i januari. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saab samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab.

 **Vi söker dig som:**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en ingenjörsexamen inom elektronik, mekatronik och/eller datateknik.
* Har ett intresse för integrationsarbete. Det är fördelaktigt om du har kunskap om kommunikationsnätverk och dataplattformar.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av hårdvara för lastbilar, stödsystem och datorer är meriterande.
* Som person trivs du med att arbeta i team och att lösa komplexa problem tillsammans med andra. Du uppskattar variation i ditt arbte och ser det som en utmaning att möta nya problem.
* Har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
* Har B-körkort

Resor kommer att förekomma i tjänsten. **Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 **Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer Tech Talent* *här**.*

 **Om kund**


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med ett långvarigt uppdrag: att hjälpa nationer att skydda sina medborgare och samhällen. Med 22 000 talanger strävar Saab ständigt efter att driva teknologins gränser framåt för att skapa en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab designar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, kommando- och kontrollsystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige, men stora operationer världen över och är en del av den nationella försvarskapaciteten i flera länder. Läs mer om Saab här.

title: Operator Sales & Partnership Manager, Nordics & Baltics
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers – no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses – including many of the world’s largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
  
We dream big – for our company, our customers and our employees – and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries – probably somewhere near you!
  
  

About the Role
  
As Operator Sales & Partnerships Manager, Nordics & Baltics you will be responsible for maintaining and developing the current partnerships with the operators in your region and acquiring new operator partnerships. You will be an integral part of our operator-facing commercial team, reporting to Director Operator Sales & Partnerships for Europe North & West. You will join an experienced team of enterprise messaging experts and a company widely recognized as one of the most successful in our industry globally.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

* Formulate and continuously adapt the strategic plan for operator relations in your region based on changes in the market and input from the Sinch sales and Routing & Compliance teams
* Execute the plan to achieve the annual targets set, including responsibility for maintaining and improving profitability.,
* Oversee and manage existing operator partnerships through monitoring and analysing the business, strengthening relationships, renegotiating commercial conditions, and finding new business opportunities together. The Operator Sales & Partnership Manager works with our Routing & Compliance, regional and strategic sales teams to optimize the benefits of our operator partnerships for our customers.
* Acquiring and signing new operator partners as well as managing the onboarding process including initiating contact, negotiating contracts and supporting the launch of the technical connections.
* Securing Sinch’s sales of products and services to the operators, with a focus on the Sinch Interconnect services. Identifying joint Sinch opportunities with mobile operators in your region, and work together with the wider Sinch sales team to develop and close opportunities for Sinch’s operator portfolio of products and services, including:
* Operator Software platforms (VAS, SMS Firewall, SMSF, RCSaaS, Identity Gateway, Voice Detection and Monetization)
* Sinch for Marketing (Personalized Video, Rich SMS)
* A2P Monetization solutions
* Formulate plans for RCS Business Messaging and other services with operators, such as Mobile Identity. Ensuring Sinch is at the forefront of sourcing such services and/or supporting the carriers in launching, managing and/or monetizing such services, thereby making them available for Sinch and our customers.
* Liaise with the relevant regulatory bodies and industry associations in your region as well as participate in relevant industry meetings and conferences


About You
  
We believe you have extensive experience from the messaging /telecom world and a strong business and technical acumen. You are comfortable in a leadership position, working with decision makers on all levels, both technical and commercial. It’s important that you are a self-starter and comfortable in new situations, can work across different time zones and also comfortable reaching out to new people for advice and support. As a person you are energetic, pragmatic, dependable, humble and you like to learn and get things done.
  
* Experience from sales or other commercial roles towards mobile operators, or have worked at a mobile network operator in a commercial role
* degree in Business Administration, engineering or similar academic area, or relevant work experience from tech-company/solution
* fluency in English


**You’ll stand out from the crowd if you have:**  

* Experience with enterprise messaging (SMS and Voice connectivity).
* Experience with mobile or digital channels.
* Experience with SaaS.
* Speak an additional European language.


Our Values
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple” and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
  
Bring your authentic self to Sinch
  
Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
  
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
  
Our Hiring Process
  
At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
  
Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
  
If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Head of Procurement
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers – no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses – including many of the world’s largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
  
We dream big – for our company, our customers and our employees – and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries – probably somewhere near you!
  
  

About the role
  
If you are a natural leader with a commercial mindset able to negotiate effectively while maintaining mutually beneficial relationships, we have the perfect job for you! We are looking for a Head of Procurement to take the lead of our indirect procurement and be responsible for the full spectrum of purchasing process including supplier selection and management, price negotiation, purchase order execution, implementation of a new ERP system, etc.
  
The global scope of this role requires someone that is a self-starter and a confident communicator that operates effectively in a global matrix organisation with the ability to identify and advise relevant stakeholders.
  
  

**As our new Head of Procurement, you will be responsible for:**  

* Develop the procurement strategy and implement plans to reduce total cost and improve quality of buying
* Setting up the procurement processes and systems to improve efficiency
* Improve our RFX processes, contract templates and compliance performance
* Develop and implement the ESG screening of suppliers
* Negotiate critical supplier contracts and lead on other key negotiations
* Deliver results on agreed KPIs for Purchasing e.g. Cost Development, #suppliers, DPO etc.
* Draft and finalize agreements, that lead to better terms and conditions for Sinch
* Leadership, lead the procurement team by providing opportunities for professional growth while maintaining a sustainable work environment


This role will be based at the HQ in Stockholm and report into the SVP Finance Operations. Travel to our different offices across the globe will be required.
  
  

About you
  
To be successful in this role you are a seasoned procurement professional working in an international company, who has a passion for improving processes and ways of working. You enjoy and are skilled in negotiation. You love working with people and are a true collaborator who has the ability to communicate and work with individuals from different cultures.
  
* Proven experience from working in Procurement, ideally from a similar size company and industry, delivering successful procurement outcomes
* Experience of working internationally with suppliers, with a good network and knowledge of running procurements across functions
* Experience of successful leadership and has the ability of inspiring and motivating teams
* A University degree, preferably within Law, Operations, Finance or related field
* Good skills in English both verbally and in writing


Our Values
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple” and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
  
  

Bring your authentic self to Sinch
  
Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
  
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
  
  

Our Hiring Process
  
At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
  
Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
  
If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/

title: Senior Solutions Architect - Auto OEM, Auto & Manufacturing
description:
* Experience within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics).
* Experience in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures
* Experience in IT development or implementation/consulting in the software or Internet industries


Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated technologists who possess a unique balance of technical depth and strong interpersonal skills. You will partner some of the worlds largest Automotive and Manufacturing companies, to craft highly scalable, flexible and resilient cloud architectures that address customer business problems and accelerate the adoption of AWS services. In collaboration with account managers, you will assist in driving growth across a set of global customers in your defined country. As a trusted customer advocate, the solutions architect will help organizations understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud. You will have the opportunity to help shape and execute a strategy to build mind share and broad use of AWS within enterprise customers. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is critical to a solutions architect. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.
  
  

**Here are some other qualities we are looking for:**  

Be great fun to work with.
  
At AWS, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge and make a big impact.
  
  

Enjoy working with large, global customers. You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud solutions for a diverse and challenging set of enterprise customers.
  
  

Have a strong understanding of large scale computing solutions. The ideal candidate will have past experience working as a systems or support engineer. You will enjoy keeping your existing technical skills honed and developing new ones, so you can make strong contributions to deep architecture discussions. You will regularly take part in deep-dive education and design exercises to create world-class solutions built on AWS.
  
  

Key job responsibilities
  
As an AWS Solutions Architect, you will have ownership of the technical relationship with customers, making recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability, operational efficiency and best-practice architectures.
  
Internally, you will be an advocate acting on behalf of the customer to help drive continual improvements to the AWS platform, sharing their needs and wants to inform the roadmap of AWS features and services. You will also help shape the future of the Solutions Architecture organisation by helping to hire, coach and mentor others.
  
In this role, your creativity will link technology to tangible solutions, with the opportunity to define or invent cloud-native reference architectures with the worldwide AWS Solutions Architect community. You will participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts) and evangelise and educate about AWS technology (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
  
If you can educate AWS customers about the art of the possible, while inspiring the impossible, come build the future with us.
  
  

About the team
  
AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
  

Why AWS
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship and Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

* Experience working within software development or Internet-related industries
* Experience migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
* Experience working with AWS technologies from a dev/ops perspective
* Experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or consulting
* Knowledge of software development tools and methodologies


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Sales Operations Specialist
description:
**Join Us as Sales Operations Specialist – Shape the Future of Growth at Paligo!**

**Are You Ready to Drive Growth in Revenue Operations?**  

At Paligo, we’re not just a SaaS company—we’re revolutionizing Component Content Management. Our cloud-based CCMS product empowers global teams to create, manage, publish, and translate essential documentation seamlessly from one platform. Trusted by industry leaders like Bitdefender, Bluetooth, Mitsubishi, the European Commission, Wrike, and Alteryx, we aim to be the top solution in our field by delivering unparalleled products and exceptional customer satisfaction.


We’re looking for a Sales Operations Specialist to further strengthen Paligo's revenue operations as our previous colleague moves on to new opportunities. This is a fantastic chance to help shape the future of Paligo's operations and revenue growth at our brand-new HQ in Solna, Stockholm.

**What You’ll Do:**

* **Empower our Commercial Teams:** Empower our Sales, Solutions Engineer, BDR, Customer Success, and Marketing teams by providing the necessary processes, tools, and resources to maximize their effectiveness.
* **Drive Process Optimization:** Evaluate and enhance lead generation and sales processes to improve efficiency, conversion rates, and reduce operational costs.
* **Deliver Analytical Insights:** Utilize your analytical expertise to provide actionable insights that will directly influence the company’s growth strategy.
* **Foster Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Work closely with leaders across Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Customer Success to ensure smooth processes and drive alignment towards our ambitious revenue goals.


**What We’re Looking For:**

* **Experience:** 5+ years relevant experience.
* **Sales & Revenue Operations Knowledge:** A solid understanding of all aspects of Sales and Revenue Operations, from strategy to tools and organizational alignment.
* **Strong Organizational Skills:** Ability to manage multiple tasks with a focus on execution and a passion for getting things done.
* **Collaboration Skills:** Excellent stakeholder management skills, with a proactive approach to identifying and solving challenges.
* **Analytical Mindset:** Strong analytical skills with a proven ability to turn data into actionable recommendations.
* **Revenue Tech Stack Management:** Experience with managing revenue-related software and tools.


**It’s a Bonus If You Also Have:**

* Experience in a SaaS environment.
* Advanced user experience with CRM, CSM, Subscription Management, and Sales Enablement tools.


**Why You’ll Love Working at Paligo:**

* **Be a Key Driver of Growth:** Your contributions will directly impact our sales and revenue operations, providing you with ownership and influence in a company with a global reach.
* **Collaborate with World-Class Teams:** Work alongside passionate, innovative colleagues and top-performing customers.
* **Grow with Us:** As Paligo scales, you’ll have ample opportunities for personal and professional growth. We’re committed to helping you achieve your career goals.
* **Inclusive Work Culture:** Paligo is an equal-opportunity employer, embracing diversity and fostering an inclusive environment for all.


**Who We Are:**  

At Paligo, we’re transforming the world of Component Content Management. Our cloud-based platform empowers companies to manage their technical, knowledge, and product documentation with ease, ensuring our clients deliver the future of content management.

**Join Us and Lead the Future of Revenue Operations!**  

If you’re excited about joining a dynamic and ambitious team, we’d love to hear from you! Check out our careers page here to learn more about our values, culture, and the incredible team you’ll be working with.

title: Marketing, Business Development & Content Creator Interns - Gain Hands-On Experience at an Award-Winning Google Cloud Partner
